alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 11:19PM EST until January 19 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Rhode Island...Massachusetts...Connecticut... Pawcatuck River At Wood River Junction affecting Washington County. Charles River At Dover affecting Middlesex and Norfolk Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Concord River At Lowell affecting Middlesex County. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sudbury River at Saxonville. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding will affect low lying areas along the river in Wayland, including a portion of Shore Road and Pelham Island Road near Heards Pond. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 PM EST Wednesday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 9.5 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late morning Thursday, or sooner if conditions warrant otherwise.late tonight at 1230 AM EST.
